text: Can hazy yellow colour with medium white head.Aroma is fresh of citra hops,yeast and acid,nice dry bitternes with good dry finish really nice overall.

Bottle shared at home. Lightly hazy yellow colour, small white big bubbly head. Nose is horseblanket, sourness, light hops, fresh green apples. Taste is medium strong sourness. Ropogósan, frissítően savanyú. Green apples in the taste as well. Very nice lambic, cant really find what the citra adds to it.
Tap at Mikkeller and Friends, Copenhagen. Pours hazy copper color. Flavor of citrus, malts, yeast, oak, fruitness. A bit tarty, medium body, hoppy and bitter.

Piwo koloru pomarańczowego, klarowne, biała szybko opadająca piana. W aromacie octowe, cytrusowe, winne, na końcu lekka stajnia. W smaku fajnie kwaśne, cytrusowe, delikatnie octowe, grejpfrutowa intensywna goryczka na finiszu. Ogólnie bardzo dobry kwasior.
Mikkeller Victoriagade: pours golden with small white head. Aroma is citrusy funk and hints of vinegar. Very citrusy in the taste. Not super sour but plenty sour enough. Pleasant to drink.
330ml bottle. Poured a golden color with a larger sized head. Citrus, fruity, and had a nice funky sourish finish.

Refrigerated 11.2 oz. aluminum can poured into a tulip. Clear golden with big white head. Aroma is nice herbal hops, medium body, medium carbonation, and little lacing. Taste is herbal hops and tart citrus.
Bottle from Whole Foods. Pours turbid and bright golden with frothy, white head. Nose is wheaty malt, yeast, hops, citrus. Tastes tart, citric, floral, hoppy. Tart and fruity finish.
Backlog, ocena przepisana z untappd, w ramach uzupełniania profilu na ratebeer. Wytrawne, kwaśne, goryczkowe, z intensywnym owocowym, cytrynowym aromatem.

Best Before 6.22.17 cans drunk 3/12 and 4/14/17.Large, expansive, foamy white head with surprisingly strong retention, tops a deep golden-brass body with a moderate haziness.The nose is fruity and fairly gentle for the series (and De Proef sours, in general). Lots of pineapple, kiwi and soft nectarine with just an afterthought of lactic acidity. Biscuity, crackery malts behind it are sparse and theres a strong earthy/musty house character leading to more lemon, lime, pineapple and black pepper on the finish. No alcohol or flaw.In the mouth its dry, though amply malted with soft wheat textures, as well. Pretty nicely done on the citra, with no heavy sweat or intense citrus dominance. Not incredibly juicy, but theres some of that here, at least. Sourness is predominantly lactic, quite tart and quenching and not terribly sour, really. Strong carbonation breaks up the body and helps disperse the hop and bacterial acidity. The second can I had, about a month after the first, was decidedly more lactic, with powdered sugar, slight metallic notes and just more overall punch and twang. More of the classic de Proef characteristics that I strongly dislike. First can was near a 4.0 while the second in the lower 3s. Rating is an average.

Ridiculously priced (almost £10) 330ml bottle from SpielBEERg in Moscow. Pours slightly hazy yellow with a small white head. Aroma is passion fruit, lemon, funk. Taste is moderate sour, tropical fruits, followed by a dry and slightly bitter finish.
From bottle at Sur & Bitter 2017, Sandnes. Pours hazy dark golden with a small white head. Aroma of lemon and grapes. Taste is weak tart and funky citrus, good one.
Bottle thanks to Rainer. Pours a cloudy orange gold with small white head that lasts. The aroma/taste is funk, grass, wheat. Tart, spice, oak, very good.

Im not a fan of the style, so my review....well, ignore it. This might be the first lambic Ive tried. Super sour, dont get much else than that, no real hops, etc. For something thats supposed to be sour, its excellent.

Can, Gull. Hazy, light amber. Thin, frothy head. Deep, aromatic citra with wood, horse blanket. Good body, chill tartness but it showcases some nice sweetness, touch of brett and just a very little funk, giving way to a bright citra finish. Quality hoppy sour. So drinkable.

BOTTLE 33 CL. Hazy golden, frothy white head. Hoppy aroma, but not exactly tropical fruit - more like pale stone fruit and flowers, even honey maybe, juicy tartness and nutty oily fruit seeds. Also some white bread crust warmth. Does not taste exactly sour, only slightly tart and really dry, subtle fruity undertones. Feels surprisingly juicy for a lambic. Light nutty and hoppy bitter finish. A very good interplay of hops and sourness.

2017/02/17 - Pours a hazy orange-honey colour with a soapy white head that quickly reduces and leaves moderate lacing. Aroma is citrus (orange, grapefruit), white wine grapes, tropical fruits, yogurt, woody notes, hints of rubber and barnyard funk. Taste is lots of fruit (tart citrus, tropical fruits), yogurt, barnyard funk and vinous notes. Mouthfeel is medium and creamy with smooth carbonation and a tart, dusty, dry finish. Creamy, fruity, tart and clean. Very nice. ---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Bottle. Hazy golden amber color, medium white head. Nice aroma of dusty peppery lemon. Taste has lightly funky citrus. Nice.

Draught: Served in a taster:
White head. Cloudy yellow body.
Nose of citrus and funk. Very inviting!
Flavour is tart, grapes, citra/citrus, bitter, light dry, funky, light vinous, some wood...
Fruity and funky...
Aftertaste is also fruity and funky. Light wood...
Low to medium carbo, light creamy dry ish mouthfeel, good medium bodied.
Good stuff!
user_location: Best of E-Town mit 2 Brauhausen, NETHERLANDS

text: Bottle; pours gold with a white head; tart citrus aroma with some apple, malt, and floral notes; taste is tart citrus with some malt and apple; finish is very dry and tart
Draft. Grass, orange peel, and biscuit malt aroma. Golden yellow with nice head. Moderately sweet funky orange biscuit malt, and moderately bitter grass/fresh hay flavor. Nice balance and body.

Une bouteille de 33cl. Une robe dorée avec une mousse blanche. Un nez incroyable de citra, cest exubérant. En bouche le liquide passe bien, ce nest pas trop « sauvage » le citra samalgame à merveille. Une finale longue et savoureuse, facile et désaltérante.

330 ml can. Pours amber with full head. Aromas of slightly funky tropical fruit, mashed pineapple and rubber. Flavors of nectarines, papaya, sour berries, and resiny tropical fruit all on a soft malty base. Lambic? I dont know, but great stuff.

Can @ Jacobs. Pours yellow with a white head, light lacings. Aroma is light sour, yeast, light barnyard, tart fruit, wine grapes, citrus, lemonpeel. Flavor is sour, light sweet malt, yeasty, grapes, citrus, lemon peel and juice. Thin body, soft to average carbonation, light acidic finish. Not alot of hops, more sour than bitter. 231216

The aroma is citrus, dont smell hops, a little bread smell. Pours a foggy orange/lemon color, with creamy off white head and excellent lacing. The taste is light bitter. The body is light, the texture creamy, the carbonation a little fizzy and the finish bitter. Very Good!
bottle. hazy golden with one finger head. my first unblended lambic, yay. funky aroma. lemony citrus bite with loads of fruitiness and plenty of funky yeast. I really liked this one.
330ml can. Pours hazy dark gold with a large head. Aroma is pissy hops, lime and light cheese. Taste has pissy hops to start with a cheesy sour, sharp grapefruit finish.

pours unclear bright gold, orange tint - or maybe its the label - with a small creamy white cap offering some retention and lacing. tangerine burst, other unknown citrus, pickled peaches, creamy lambic, woody with firm tannins, light to medium acidity - yet in feels on-the-spot and fairly complex; fragrant boreal herbs, sea salt. moderate carbonation, light body, dry, tart, woodsy-vinous and citrusy finish. very solid fruity dry-hopped lambic. of course citra is a favourite for me, yet it shines in such an uncommon fashion.
backlog. clear light golden. Funky citrus aroma. Tart and sour yet very sessionable. Best of the spontandryhop series
10.11.2016 at Koelschip Copenhagen (tap) - Fruity citrus and grass aromas with sour note. Bit sweet spontan sour ale with sour lemon taste and dry citra hop finish.

Pours clear blonde,small white head. Smell is sour, dry, funk, bit bitter. Not really citrussy specifically. Taste is Sharp, bit sour, rather sweet though not nearly as bitter as expected . Some aromatic from the hops. Ok.

Bottle from Wine & Cheese. Pours translucent gold with a white head. Aroma is sort of funky citrus. Med minus body. Flavor is mildly sour, funky citrus. Quite pleasant actually. Finishes dry, funky, citrus. Nice.

Bottle pour at Mellow Mushroom. Thanks Atticus! Pours a bright gold with 2 fingers of foam. Tropical nose with mango and pineapple shining through. Good, brett, horseblanket nose. Clean on the palate with good acidity. Easy drinking and very bright and dry. Great stuff.

Bouteille 330ml. Couleur jaune-orangée trouble, mousse blanche laissant un anneau sur les parois du verre. Arôme de citron, pamplemousse blanc, Brett, zeste de pamplemousse. Goût de pamplemousse blanc, Brett, acidité moyenne, amertume moyenne, pointe de citron. Carbonatation moyenne-élevée, corps moyen.
Yellow-orange, small head, floral aroma, lambic, lemony, fun, very fresh, sour flavor, lemony, awesome, tea, lemony, green tea, medium bodied.

(33 cl. BB.02/03/21) Du Citra bien senti avec poussière de funk et un fruité en constante évolution. Au goût, jai comme limpression de mordre dans un agrume juteux et de boire en même temps un beau lambic. En bouche, le liquide montre un corps presque huileux avec un jeu normal des bulles. La finale est citrique, longue, fraîche. Très bon jus.

Merci à Cédrick pour cette bière dune magnifique fraîcheur! Robe orangée qui rappelle la couleur de la chair dabricot. Tête dabord abondante formée de grosses bulles plutôt collant au verre avant de sévanouir. Une découverte pour moi dune facette cachée de ce houblon qui jusquici mest apparu tel comme un houblon unidimentionel et dont je croyais avoir fait le tour il y a de cela un bon moment déjà. Salade de fruits tant en bouche quau nez où je passe de la mandarine à lagrume, à lananas. Le funk supporte admirablement ce houblon aux notes complexes sans amertume. Le côté sauvage est bien présent sans jamais tomber dans la brette grossière et surfaite. Acidité balancée et cohérente qui laisse pleinement le première rôle et tous les honneurs au houblon. Très belle performance de cette brasserie dont jétais plutôt las.

UPDATED: APR 20, 2017 How : can Appearance : almost clear light golden with a medium to small white head. Aroma : fresh orange, lemon juice, grass, floral, apples, herbs, tropical fruits and some light syrup tones. Palate : medium body, lively carbonation.

UPDATED: OCT 30, 2016 Almost clear golden with a frothy white head and lovely lacing. Intense hit of citrus, apricot and and other fruits followed by berries, funk and vinegary notes. Medium sourness, hints of bitterness in the aftertaste. Wonderful dry palate, high carbonation. Amazing!

Bottle from private import thx Alex for arranging this. A: peaches, light citrusy App: hazy pale smallish white head. T/p: thin body with long acidic finish, an acidity although really present that doesnt bite. Moderate high carbonation. O: Just by smelling it, citra doesnt come out as strong than when you have it in mouth. Loads of peaches appear. Really glad I had it since its that good.

Small format bottle poured into a belgian tulip. The beer is a clear copper with a big head of white foam. The aroma has notes of juicy citra hops. Makes me think of orange juice, actually. Juicy sour oranges come through strongly. Delicious. Medium body and medium carbonation.

Pours a clear golden with a medium white head that leaves nice lacing. Nose is of grassy - and dank, even - hops with some good hints of the sourness to come. Taste gently tart and nicely hoppy again. Fruity and grassy hops with some good lambic funk in the back. Body is light to medium and carbonation moderately high. As expected, the Citra version steals the show. This SpontanDryhop series is damn fine overall!

330ml bottle from private import. Aroma: intense aroma coming from that citra dry hop. Some resinous pine, tropical fruits. App: cloudy orange, small white head with ok retention and leaving some lacing. Taste and palate: medium body, resinous, dry fruity & herbal and acidity finish. Overall: wow. That exceeded my expectations. Im usually disappointed in Mikkeller Spontan series but this dryhop series seems to be much more better at least to my tastes. Im surprised that a beer that was dry hopped coming from private import was successful in keeping this big citra aroma. I enjoyed the resinous texture this dry hop gave to the beer. Really easy to drink. Success Mikkeller.
Tap at @ Basement Beer Bar, Aalborg. Aroma of cirus and tart brett. Hazy amber with white head, mostly dim. Light+ sour, light bitter and dry. Medium body, oily feel and citrus brett finish.

On tap. Golden color, hazy liquid, white head. Dominant aroma of grapefruit, other notes like zest and other citruses are only in background. Taste is medium heavy sour (not that heavy as expected), light medium bitter. Well done, but very expensive.
Yellow color with foam layer. Sour citrus nose. Sour taste with a fresh hoppy solid bitterness without a too extreme sourness. Sourish hoppy finish with a light milky feeling.

Riecht und schmeckt wie ein Bastard aus Sour Ale und Pale Ale. Cirusfruityness und Brettästhetik vereinen sich zu einer grasig scharfen Knospenerfrischung. Der Nachhall zwar wundervoll, aber leider auch einen Tick zu kurz. Na ja, hat ja auch nicht viele Umdrehungen das Gute 😉. Lecker. 0,33/52DKK die Dose. Vom MIKKELLER BOTTLE SHOP in Kopenhagen.

Aroma: sour berries and fruity hops. 
Flavour: fruity sour with a dirtlike dry finish. 
Colour: yellow with a white head. 
From: can @ Voldby Købmandsgård Aug. 2016.

330 ml bottle into tulip glass, best before 3/2/2021. Pours slightly hazy golden orange color with a 1 finger fairly dense white head with good retention, that reduces to a small cap that lingers. Nice spotty soapy lacing clings on the glass, with a moderate amount of streaming carbonation retaining the cap. Aromas of big tart lemon, lime, passion fruit, guava, tangerine, grapefruit, orange peel, hay, straw, musty funk, pepper, wheat, cracker, and floral/grassy earthiness. Damn nice aromas with great balance and complexity of fruity/funky/acidic yeast, citrus/tropical hops, and light-moderate pale malt notes; with great strength. Taste of big tart lemon, lime, passion fruit, guava, tangerine, grapefruit, orange peel, hay, straw, musty funk, pepper, wheat, cracker, and floral/grassy earthiness. Moderate sourness and yeast spiciness on the finish; with lingering notes of lemon, lime, passion fruit, guava, tangerine, grapefruit, orange peel, hay, straw, musty funk, pepper, and floral/grassy earthiness on the finish for a good bit. Damn nice complexity, robustness, and balance of fruity/funky/acidic yeast, citrus/tropical hops, and light-moderate pale malt flavors; with a great malt/sour/spiciness balance, and zero astringent flavors after the finish. Medium carbonation and light-medium body; with a very smooth, crisp, dry, acidic, and lightly grainy mouthfeel that is great. Zero warming alcohol as expected of 5.5%. Overall this is an excellent dry hopped unblended Lambic! All around great complexity, robustness, and balance of fruity/funky/acidic yeast, citrus/tropical hops, and light-moderate pale malt flavors; very smooth, crisp, and easy to drink with the moderate acidity. A very enjoyable offering.

UPDATED: DEC 25, 2016 From tap at Mikkeller Bar, Copenhagen. Aroma is fresh citrus, lemon, bretty funk, notes of tropical fruits and grass. Flavour is moderate to medium sour. Body is medium. Great stuff, nicely citrussy hoppy and smooth sourness, very drinkable.
0,33l can in the park. Nice fruity, flowery,citrusy nose. Taste is fresh sour, with some hoppy, citrusy aftertaste. Very refreshing summer beer!

Thank you for sharing! Sampled 330 ml. bottle @ Gents Bierfestival 2016. Hazy orange, little white. Nose is a bit mutter, low funk, basic lemon, zest, some dirty funk. Taste is cold water, same for body, soft carbonation, lemon, mop brett, some dirty brett, largely easy to drink lemon, zest, lactic sour, Easy, less expressive than Simcoe or Centennial. Least favourite but still easy & fun to drink.

Small white head over hazy orange beer. Nice lemony citra nose at first, but gradually overtaken by the wet mop - again. Lemon, citrus, rainwater, nice restrained acids. Light, tittilating carbonation, refreshing. Way better than the Centennial, but I keep hating those lab Bretts.
Bottle at Gents Bierfestival. Funky, sour, light hoppy, love it to be honest.
This beer is intense, complex and balanced. The dry hopping with citra adds a very nice fruit flavour to this otherwise perfect sour beer!

330 ml bottle at the Hoppy Pub, Thessaloniki. Light hazy golden orange color with white head. Hoppy and yeasty aroma, tart citrusy fruity, tropical fruits, bretty, barnyard notes. Sweet, bitter and acidic taste like aroma. Medium oily body with soft to average carbonation.

Bottle shared by Tom. Clear gold pour with nice white head. Aroma is super fruity, light cat piss aroma, very fruity, citrusy, nice dry grassy notes. Taste is tart, fruity, nice grass, great dry hopped sour. Palate is light bodied, dry, nice carb. Good stuff.

Bottle (330 ml) shared with JulienHuxley. Clar bright orangey-golden with a medium white head leaving little lacing. Aroma is bright and citrusy with nice herbal hops, some funk, pinapples/tropical fruits and hay. Taste is moderately sour with bright citrus presence, nice funk and hints of barnyard and herbal notes. Medium body. Moderate carbonation. Citrusy finish. Really good dry-hopped sour ale with nice citrusy features.

0.15 l from tap at Kafé België. Clear, golden amber with a thin, almost creamy, white head. Sourish-fruity, moderately funky aroma of lots of lemon, gooseberry, mango, pineapple and some barnyard. Quite sour but not overly so, very fruity and moderately funky taste of lots of lemon, gooseberry, mango, passion fruit, barnyard and oak, followed by a medium long, rather tart and very woody-dry finish. Medium body, tangy, quite astringent and moderately effervescent mouthfeel, soft to average carbonation. Very good!
Aroma is Cites/orange and sour fruit. The flavor is citrus/orange, hops, malts and a slightly sugary/bitter/spicy finish.

Aroma:

Medium aroma of malts, wheat, tropical fruit, hops, citrus, brettanomyces and acidity.

Appearance:

Hazy/turbid yellow/golden beer with a slight/medium white head.

Taste/Palate:

Starts medium/heavy sweet with malts, wheat and tropical fruit; ends slightly bitter, dry and sour with hops, citrus, brettanomyces and acidity.

Overall:

This beer is intense, complex and balanced. The dry hopping with citra adds a very nice fruit flavour to this otherwise perfect sour beer!

Bottle (from mikkeller webshop). Pours golden with whiteish head. The small head stays. Aroma is sour, funky, medicinal, citrus, sweetness. Flavor is sour and bitter, citrus, funky notes, lemon, medicinal notes. Overall: very good.
Big citrus aromas with a balanced funk to the aroma. Lasting white head slight haze to this copper orange. Sharp sour citrus funk hits then mellows to a nice lemon finish.

330ml bottle from Brewdog shop.
Small white head, nice lacing. Hazy golden amber body. Nose is funky citrus, lemon, sweet orange. Flavour is tart zesty citrus, yeast, sherbet lemon, lots of funk, citrus hops, bitter lemon finish. Light carbonation, crisp mouthfeel. Really good.

Bottle. Pours clear golden, small off-white head, decent lacing. Aroma is loaded with citra, cheery passionfruit, guava, lemon, lime, some Brett. Flavor is dry, very light bitterness, light tartness, light funk, mineral water, hints of cheese and lots of citra. Medium body, soft carbonation. Grate.

Bottle. Sensoric. Amber/orange, medium hazy witm small to medium, white, densed head. Medicore head retention and lacing. Aroma is tart, citric with nice acccents of lightly citrus and tropical fruits-like hops. Taste is medium sour, medium-dry bitter in the end. Medium body, creamy texture, lively carbonation, finish is nicely sour. In general well matched sourness witharomatic hoppy profile.
bottle shared. sour and hoppy mix produces a stanky brew, with lemon and orange peel, light vinegar and oakiness. Pretty nice overall.

21.06.2016, 0,33l bottle @ home
Nice fizzy-creamy mediumlasting head, slightly hazy. Aroma is fresh sour-ish fruity, citrus peel, soda powder, sorrel, fresh hops, unripe berries, citrus, minerals, oak, tropical fruits. Taste is sour-ish dry, citrus peel, sorrel, citrus, soda powder, unripe berries, minerals, fresh hops, fresh wood, grass, grape juice. Medium to longlasting, sour-ish dry mouthfeel. Nice.
On tap at Pinocchios. Murky yellow pour, no head. Funky aroma. Leathery funk with a mild fruity citrus. Awesome mouthfeel, thick and coating. Im not a lambic guy, but this is wonderfully wild.
On tap at Mikkeller Bar SF. Pours golden with a thick white head and a strong citrus aroma. There is a hearty pale mslt flavor, slightly sour with a dry finish.

ça schlingue lécurie et déjà cest bon signe ! ça sent aussi presque la criée juste après la vente du poisson ... En bouche, cest une longue traînée acide mais pas agressive ... Tout en bulles en fait ... Un peu trop direct et pas super compliqué ... Mais sympathique tout de même ...

Bottle, [email protected]/* <![CDATA[ */!function(t,e,r,n,c,a,p){try{t=document.currentScript||function(){for(t=document.getElementsByTagName('script'),e=t.length;e--;)if(t[e].getAttribute('data-cfhash'))return t[e]}();if(t&&(c=t.previousSibling)){p=t.parentNode;if(a=c.getAttribute('data-cfemail')){for(e='',r='0x'+a.substr(0,2)|0,n=2;a.length-n;n+=2)e+='%'+('0'+('0x'+a.substr(n,2)^r).toString(16)).slice(-2);p.replaceChild(document.createTextNode(decodeURIComponent(e)),c)}p.removeChild(t)}}catch(u){}}()/* ]]> */, Cph. Pours clear golden with a small, staying, creamy white head. Aroma has lovely fresh hops, tartness, citric, oranges, funk. Medium to high carbonation, fine dry and quite light mouthfeel. Flavour has elegant tartness, citric, light vinious, good bitterness. Extremely well balanced. Lovely.
Bottle. Light hazy dark gold. Thin head. Taste is medium bitter and medium sour. Medium body. Long dry finish. Aroma is mango, pinneapple, barnyard, spices, grass.

Bottle 330ml. [ As Mikkeller Spontandryhop Citra ].Clear medium orange yellow color with a average, frothy, good lacing, mostly lasting to diminishing, white head. Aroma is moderate malty, pale malt, moderate to heavy hoppy, citrus, moderate yeasty, barnyard, leather, farmyard, moderate tropical fruit - fruity. Flavor is moderate sweet, acidic and bitter with a long duration, tart citrus, dry, farmyard, funky, moderate tropical fruit. Body is medium, texture is oily to watery, carbonation is soft. [20160502]

330ml bottle. Golden colour with a white foam head leaving some lacing. Aroma of apricot & citrus, lemon rind, funk. Taste is fruity citrus, sour lemon, zesty, grainy, barnyard with grapefruit bitterness. Light to medium bodied, soft carbonation, dry sour finish. Very drinkable.

330ml bottle from Saveur Biére - Hazy orange body, lively looking fizzy off white head. Nose is sweetly citric, a little bit of hop at the forefront and a bit of Brett. Taste is a great grapefruit cocktail, lots of bitterness on the lips, great freshness. Nice dry finish.
Draught at Mikkeller & Friends. Tap takeover. Hoppy tart tropical fruit sour goodness.
Tap @ Christian 4tal Pale Ale Festival 2016, Odense. Pours hazy orange with a creamy head. Fruity citra and funk. Delicious. Clean - No popcorn or leather. Funky dry finish. Yes!
Very nice quality refreshment. One of the few sourish brews where hops prevail. Light acidic but fresh citrus fruitiness, grapefruit, lemon, berries. Light sweetness with moderate sourness. Lovely

Pours hazy light amber with minimal white head
Aromas tart and funky, citrusy fruits, gooseberries, acidic, garden leaves
Taste has tart notes of ripe red apples, grapes, citrusy fruits, slight herbal, garden leaves,

Tap to bottle from Alus Cella (Thank you, Sten!)
The look is misty light amber. Lots of apricot in the aroma. The ttaste too has tons of apricot, and anna also gets membranes between grapefruit segments. This leaves a nice little bit of stickiness on the palate. May be a bit flat perhaps, but it did come from a 1 L bottle. There was some weird stir-fry thing going on for Phil on the last sip. 
Nicely drinkable, and the sharpness keeps it drinkable sip after sip.

Bottle 33cl, a cloudy copper orange beer with low head. Nose is sour like with orange, lemon and lactic notes. Aroma is very lactic like, very dry, barnyard notes, quince and mandarina, moist, wild yeast. Fine especially for the summer.

Gylden klar skum hvid 
Citrus frugt stald humle 
Sur lidt bitter modrate 
Tør livlig 
@f1
Draft. Hazy golden color with a small white head. Aroma of citra, hops, horse. Taste is pleasantly lemon sour, hops and grass. Ends off with a nice crisp citrus finish. Quite nice.

Bottle from Boxbeers. Hazy golden with a lasting white head. Aroma is sweet, malty, light barnyard and rather hoppy - fruity. Flavor is medium sweet, moderate bitter and light acidic. Dry, moderate bitter and light acidic finish. 240416

Keg in the Micro Bar, Reykjavik. Hazy golden with a thin off white head. Light sour citrus aroma with a little funk. The taste is super sour grapefruit juice at first, slightly salty with a dry funky finish. Extremely refreshing and very good.

On tap in the Micro Bar in Reykjavik. Pours light golden and cloudy in the glass with not much head. Really flowery nose and slightly eucalyptus. Taste is lemon juice and some medicinal elements with a slightly tart finish.
Tap @ Mikkeller, Aarhus. Nice head with good duration. Color is golden. Aroma and taste are brett, rich citrus, flowers, fruits, malt and hops. Nice long bitter and sour finish. Lovely.
Bottle. Hazy golden with a white head. Earthy, funky aroma with citrus. Taste is fruity with sourness. Medium body. Great and refreshing beer.

Tap @ Mikkeller Aarhus. Pours golden orange amber with a white head. Aroma of mandarin juice, orange, lemon, citrus, slight pineapple, tart acidity and some hoppy notes as well. Amazing! The taste is sour with notes of tropical fruits, mandarin juice, slight hoppy notes and citrus! Amazing stuff!

Draft. A hazy golden beer with a lazing yellowish head. The aroma has notes of lemons, hops, dust, funk, and brettanomyces. The flavor is acidic with notes of brettanomyces, dusty hops, and lemons, leading to a tart finish.

[email protected]/* <![CDATA[ */!function(t,e,r,n,c,a,p){try{t=document.currentScript||function(){for(t=document.getElementsByTagName('script'),e=t.length;e--;)if(t[e].getAttribute('data-cfhash'))return t[e]}();if(t&&(c=t.previousSibling)){p=t.parentNode;if(a=c.getAttribute('data-cfemail')){for(e='',r='0x'+a.substr(0,2)|0,n=2;a.length-n;n+=2)e+='%'+('0'+('0x'+a.substr(n,2)^r).toString(16)).slice(-2);p.replaceChild(document.createTextNode(decodeURIComponent(e)),c)}p.removeChild(t)}}catch(u){}}()/* ]]> */, Copenhagen - Orange pour with white head. Aroma and taste is big citrus fruity with prominent orange and lemon notes, light straw, grassy hoppy backing, with a nice fruity tart finish. Good stuff.
From tap at Taphouse. Hazy orange colour with a white head. Aroma and flavour of malt, fruit, hops, spice, yeast and berries.

April 3, 2016. Bottle, best before March 2, 2021. 
Clear golden with a large and creamy white head. Aroma is fruity, hoppy and light funky with mango, pineapple, orange, lemon, grass, toffee, light barnyard with some buttery notes beneath. Taste is light sweet, funky, fruity and soft sour. Finish is a bit thin and watery with sour lemon juice, light fruity sweetness, some dry grassy notes and barnyard. Light to medium bodied, small bubble carbonation, slight oily texture at first but quite thin finish. 
Okay, nice fruitiness but the light buttery notes and the thin finish lowers the score...

Bottled. Pours slightly hazy yellow with a small white head. Aroma of citrus, peach, gooseberry, tropical fruit, funk and barnyard. Slightly sweet flavor that ends up dry and tart. Light to medium bodied, watery to oily texture and soft carbonation. An excellent Sour. 🌟🌟🌟🌟

17/III/16 - 33cl bottle @ De Proefbrouwerij (Lochristi) - BB: 2/III/21 (2016-280) Thanks to Dirk for the excellent tour and samples!
Clear blond beer, small irregular white head, unstable, non adhesive. Aroma: fruity, sweaty feet, bit cheesy, tropical fruit. MF: ok carbon, medium body. Taste: lots of citrus, bit sour, lemon drops, little bitter, frapefruit. Aftertaste: fruity, lots of lemon juice, sourish, bit of grapefruit, soft bitterness.

Pours Hazy golden with medium creamy white head. Nose is citrus. Aromas are citrus, grapefruit, lemon, herbal hops. Average carbonation, medium body. Long tart and citrus finish. Really nice and pleasant lambic, balanced between acidity, bitterness and sweetness, flavourfull brew.

clear golden pilsner-like color, little white head, strong hop aroma, a little funk, nice creamy mouthfeel, low to medium sour, some fruits(apple) and a lot of citrus, little bitterness, some funk/barnyard, bitter funky dryhop finish, lively carbonation

bottle sample, deep cloudy hazed golden pour with a white head. nose of sweet passion fruits, tangerines, spiced brett notes, grains, and small amount of funk, fresh lemons, and a small bitter white grape notice. nice sweet peach note in the back. very refreshing with a nice funky sour note! nice!

12 oz. bottle from my Secret Santa. Thanks man! Pours a hazed golden with a small white head. Aroma of earth, funk, hay, and citrus and papaya. Flavor is tart with mild sweetness. Tropical fruit hops shine through the layers of tartness. Medium bodied, slick on the palette. Finishes with a lingering tartness. Very nice.

Lite sur och frisk. Grumlig och ljus. Inte min typ av öl. Blir blaskig och lite trist

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Hazy orange color with white head. Aroma has farmhouse funk, hay, barnyard, flowers, grass and sour stonefruits. Taste starts tart and fruity. The funky notes are also present in the taste but more in the background. The juicy, fruity hops are in the front here. Body is medium and quite smooth with nice carbonation. I really enjoy this style of beer. Hoppy, tart and slightly funky.

Bottle, new years eve 2015-16. Hazy orange body with a fine white head. Funky orange aroma with grapefruit, dry tart fruit taste, the citra is quite noticable here, sour and refreshing finish. Quite a great one.

Draught @ BBB. Pours hazy golden with a frothy white head that slowly dissipates while leaving some thick spotty trace on the glass. Smell is fruity, grassy and slightly funky with crackers, caramel, lemon juice, grapefruit juice, mango, pineapple, moist grass, pine needles, dry soil, barnyard, leather, minerals and lemon zest. Taste is sour, fruity, tiny grassy and tiny funky. Mouthfeel is oily, dry, tart, tiny mouth-puckering and medium bodied. Finish is sour with crackers, caramel, lemon juice, grapefruit juice, mango, moist grass, pine needles, dry soil, barnyard and lemon zest. Tasty straight-forward hoppy lambic.

20-JUN-2015, draft @my 50-years birthday.
I bought a keg of this with the purpose of creating beer-cocktails. I consumed quite a few glasses of this on its own during the party.
What a wonderfull drink.
Hazy yellow with white head.
Citra is very obvious but merries very well with the lambic stuff. Really fresh, fruity and tart.
Masses of citra on the nose, leading to big funky, sour farmyard flavours with a spiky bitterness from the hops. Great melding of two styles. Lovely.

330mL bottle, pours a cloudy vibrant golden orange with a small white head. Nose brings out shitloads of dank citra dry hopping, mixed with lovely wild yeasts and funky sour notes. Flavour is very funky and dry hopped, with a wonderful marriage of the two styles. For 5.5%, this is bursting with flavour, and despite being fairly heavy on both styles, it remains massively drinkable. Wonderful stuff.

Tap. Shakespeares, Sheffield. Mucky gold. Film of dense, white head. Aroma manages dank and sour at the same time. Liquified lemon cheesecake, that may or may not be on the turn. Youd probably chance it, though. Taste is light sour. Citric bitter. Palate is lightly acidic. Soft fizz. Finishes long, tart, astringently bitter. Very nice.

on tap at mikkeller and friends. lightly hazed yellow-to-golden with a minimal head; great nose - roll in the hay, passionfruit vine, white grapeskin; lightly chalky mouthfeel; good balance between some fresh, zesty bitterness and somewhat cheesy funk; very moreish - extra marks for being the only sour that agreed with my troubled stomach during rbesg2015

Keg, Brewdog Leicester. Hazy golden yellow with a thin head. Spritzy lemony yeast with light cheesy funk. Woody with floral notes. Tart with fresh bitter grapefruit and green pine lurking somewhere beneath. Hints of white grape and peach. Mellow citra, puckering palate.

From tap. Pours hazy orange with a medium white head. Loads of funky citrusy notes along with peach, gooseberry and passion fruit. Awesome freshness. Great citrusy, grapefruit, passion fruit and gooseberry taste. Lots of funky stuff going on. Wow! Stunned by the freshness!

Bottle from Gonzo. Majestic nose awash with hairy stems, toilet rug pissed on by a cat, sharp unripe mango, rotting hay, almost ganja. Throughout the lime, funk and sour oak of spontaneous Belgians. Easy acid, passion fruit sharpness, hop lost to funk, minuscule processed cheese streaks, the salivating tang of lemon sherbet. Dusted gold with a plump white collar at first. Sublime. Except not enough Citra- its only really discernible in the aroma.
Tap at Mikkeller. Great aroma, very fruity, bit grassy, grape, white wine. Nice, light sourness, white wine. Grassy.

Draught. Hazy yellow in color, off-white head. Earthy notes, some citrus and funkiness in aroma. Tart, and there might be some herbal indications here too. Lemon, vinegar and funky notes in taste. The tartness is present too. Feels quite dry, but theres present a quite nice juicy touch with some peachy notes. Pleasant one.
@ Mikkeller Viktoriagade, København 15-8-7: Stor syrlighet, fina distinkta citrustoner. Riktigt gott

On tap at Mikkeller Bar. 

Hazy golden/orange with a small white head. A bit sour aroma of hay, hops, funk and citrus. Similar taste. An interesting and refreshing combination.

Tap at mikkeller bar. Notes from #eurobeersafari II
Looks..golden Amber, sml head
Smells..tart funky and fruity, slight piney hop character 
Tastes... Tarty fruity, delicately sour with a hop presence that feels slightly earthy.. Some white vinous character too.
On tap at Mikkeller Bar, Copenhagen. Pours cloudy yellow, small white head. Great fruity aroma, nice citrus fruity and sourish flavor. Very refreshing. Great combination.

Keg at The Hanging Bat. Pours cloudy golden. Nose is sour freshly cut lime, light yeast, fruits. Taste is tart and sour, lime, lemon, fruits, grass and piney hops. Strong lime and lemon but very good sour.

Golden, clear, medium white foam, citruses, acidic, some funky notes, medium sourness, lightly bitter and sweet, light body, quite thin feel, crisp, lively carbonation, long dry and sweet finishOverall: Refreshing, highly drinkable, great taste and aroma,-- rated with beerbasher

On tap @ Henrik, Bergen. Pours hazy orange, with a tiny creamy head. Aroma is initially very hop forward with fruity tropical notes and some sweet citrus, followed nicely by wooden brett and funky farmhouse notes, as well as notes of gooseberries and light currants. Medium body, with soft carbonation. Flavour is sour, with wooden notes of brett and lactic acid, as well as berries and some balancing floral notes. Lingering floral brett in the finish.
Tap at mikkeller bar. Cloudy yellow small white head. Aroma is Sourish quite hoppy balanced. Flavor is dry hoppy and quite pleasant Sourish.

Bottle
Aroma-sour, fruits, barnyard
Appearance-pale, hazy, white foam, 
Taste-medium sourness, light sweetness, 
Palate-light body, sticky, average carbonation, sour finish
Overall-very refreshing
Una de las grandes sorpresas de este caluroso verano 2015, thanks mikkel for this great beer . I can't stop to drink that amazing beer. Fresh , hoppy and sour!

Bottle. Hazy citra hops colour. Medium sized white head. Funky nose with some barnyard, leather and peach, kiwi whatever. The flavour is pretty fruity and floral; peach, mango, elderflower, lime, passion fruit with a clean sourness that lasts long. Light barnyard, cheese and wood also. Medium body, easy drinking, refreshing.

27th June 2015Hazy gold beer, small pale cream colour head. Palate is light, semi dry and crisp. Mildly tart citric lemon and orange followed by yellow grapefruit and a touch of peel .The lemon gets tarter on the finish. Clean and refreshing and not overly sour.

Bottle sample at a tasting at Ariels place. Thanks guys. Clear gold with a white ring. Lactic, lots of tropical fruit in the nose - especially mango. Very sour, funky and mango and citrus in the mouth. Medium body, mildly sour finish and a soft fizz.
Draught. Creamy White good mostly lasting head. Yellow colour. moderate malty and heavy hoppy very sour aroma. Heavy bitter wonderfull sour flavor. Long heavy bitter finish. Creamy palate. Nice.

Bottle sample at a tasting. Thanks! Clear yellow golden color. Splendid fruity hops aroma with light green and wood notes. Pleasant fruity tartness with herbal bitterness. Medium bodied, oily on palate. Very good.

Bottle shared at a tasting at Ariels place. Slightly hazy golden with a white head. Great aroma of fruity hops, sweat, funk, oak. Sour and funky flavor with fruity hops, a bit of lacto, sweat. Medium-bodied. Great stuff.

Keg @El Lúpulo Feroz, Oviedo. 15-06-2015.
In short: dry fruity ale.
Pours hazy dark gold with nice white head. Short head retention, some lacing. Brett, barnyard, fruity nose. Light body, high carbonation, crispy texture. Taste is tart, fruity. Long lasting mouthfeel, dry and astrigent finish.

Almost clear gold color, nice white head. Aroma of gralefruit, lemon, orange zest, acidic, hint of pineapple. Taste is medium sour and funky lemonade flavor with wine and sour apples notes, hint of bretta. Aftertaste is dry, tart with lemon flavor. Light body, medium carbonation. Drinkable stuff.
Bottled:Pours hazy amber with a thick head.Sour and fruity aroma of apricots, nettles and funk. Sour taste of grapefruit, lime, apricots and grapes.Very refreshing!

Tap @ MikkellerBar, Viktoria. Hazy yellow with small white head. Aroma is malt, fruit, brett, tart, citrus and grapefruit. Flavour is malt, fruit, tart, brett, citrus, grapefruit, pine, medium sweet, medium bitter, hop and a little dry.

Stora vita bubblor i en benvit krona. Grumlig bärnstenaktig färg. Len i doft men yppar armhåla, höstlov, mjölk å en gnutta av Roberto fabricatos underliv. Härlig syrlighet med starka suris godisar av hö, höst & kompost kompressat av härligheten av Citra & ton av små beska i eftersmaken. Samt nåt jag inte kan sätta fingret på.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
On tap. @El Lúpulo Feroz, Oviedo 12/06/2015. Color ámbar, aroma afrutado, toques ácidos. Cuerpo medio

Kolor: pomarańczowy, lekko opalizujące. Piana: dość obfita ale bardzo szybko opada, biała, średnie i duże pęcharze. Zapach: multiwitamina, słodkie owoce tropikalne, kwiaty, bardzo rzeski, lekka stajnia, kwaśność. Smak: mega kwaśne, wysokie nasycenie, lekko przypomina szampana, wytrawne. W smaku dominuje kwaśność ale przyjemna, potęgowana wysokim nasyceniem. Cytryna, żólte kwaśne owoce, skórka pomarańczy, lekkie cytrusy, dzikość, lekka stajnia. Bardzo fajne połączenie dzikości, stajni, kwasu z citrą, która wnosi smak i aromat owoców, bez dodatku soku z owoców.

Caña en el lúpulo el 12-06-2015. (R41) color ámbar anaranjado con poca espuma beige. Aromas ácidos ligeramente cítricos de naranjas mandarinas y pomelo. Sabores intensos ácidos con toques cítricos de mandarinas algo de pomelo con un amargo no muy intenso final, perfectamente combinado. Cuerpo medio con 5.5 vol algo pastosa Bastante buena en su estilo.

UPDATED: FEB 23, 2017 Jabeerwocky z kranu. Na szybko: bez specjalnej piany, przejrzyste, jasne. w aromat: owoce tropikalne (multi, ale brzoskwinia z pomarancza wioda prym), funky, lekko kwasne. W smaku tez owocowe, oczywiscie kwasne ale nie jakos ekstremalnie, jakies slodkie nuty tez pozostaja. goryczka niska, niejako zastapiona cierpkoscia wysoka, taninowa, zwlaszcza w posmakach na jezyku. mimo to bardzo dobre, o dziwo pasuje fajnie do nachosow :)Ocena potraktowana skryptem do przeliczania ocen (uzgodnienie UT/RB).

UPDATED: JUN 12, 2015 Amarela levemente turva, espuma branca de pouca duração e média quantidade. Aroma bastante cítrico, ácido, laranja, vinagre de maça, só um pouco de dulçor ao final do copo. Paladar de acidez média , intensificando o sabor de laranjas. Carbonação média, corpo leve. Refrescante. Aftertaste lembra limão siciliano, acerola, acidez que da lugar a um pouco de amargor.

Keg at BD Sheps Bush, 11/06/15.
Lightly hazed orange golden with a decent off white cap.
Nose is restrained funk, bitter citric peel, straw, lemon rind, earthy hop dust, Mandarin. 
Taste comprises pissy citrics, barnyard, citric hop bang, straw, funk, jism bush, light wood, lemon curd.
Medium bodied, fine carbonation, semi drying close with light acidic puckerings. 
Xolid hopped oop xour
user_location: Hazlemere, the lower Xhitlerns, Buckinghamshire, ENGLAND

text: A great sour, with real lemon notes, plus the burst of hops. Very complex for a 5% abv beer

Keg at BD Shepherds Bush. It pours clear golden-amber with a small white head. The nose is earthy, funky, big brett action, Irn Bru, sherbet, stewed orange, candied peel, hay, floral, damp wood and vanilla. The taste is earthy, funky brett, juicy orange, tangerine, mango, passion fruit, sherbet, pissy aspect, some acidity, white grape skin, vinous-like quality, florals, wood and vanilla with a dry finish. Medium body and fine, prickly carbonation. Delicious stuff. Funk, fruity and crushable. Easily one of Mikkellers best sours.

How: Bottle..
Where: Mogwai, Helsingborg.
Appearance: Hazy dark golden colour with a white head.
Aroma: Citrus, fruit, a bit sour.
Body: Medium body and carbonation.
Flavour: Citrus, some floral notes, fruit, hops, a bit sour.

Rund fruchtig säuerlicher Antrunk, vollmundig. Steigende Säure, milde Herbe, wenig trocken. Pfirsich, spritzig, etwas Zitrus. Minimaler Hopfen. Langer, fruchtig saurer Nachgeschmack. 10/12/12/11/10/12
Keg at brewdog Aberdeen. Pours hazy orange amber, nose is huge funk, orange, taste is juicy citrus, dry, sour.
Keg at brewdog... Golden amber.. Thin white lacing... Soft funk.. Big soft sour fruits.. Big barnyard funk

Bottle 33 cl. Pours a hazy golden with a white head. Very tart aroma blending in nicely with the hops. Medium body, some initial fruitiness, but very, very dry and tart. A little late note of baking yeast. But generally very enjoyable. 040615

Keg at BD Shoreditch, London. It pours a slightly hazy pale golden color with a small ring of white bubbles. Aroma is fruity saucy meaty and peppery, a mix between orange juice, peach juice and a Bloody Mary. Taste is sour and acidic an only mildly bitter.notes of peaches hay apricots black pepper green pepper a-la mamouche. Light bodied with good carbonation. Overall, delicious and unique. Forza Juve
330ml bottle from Cornelius. Pours clear gold, thin white head. Sour sherbet and grapefruit aromas. Taste is sour, light sherbet notes, big sour citrus kick. Light body, sour finish.
Tap at mikkeller, cph. Hazy orange color, white head. Sour aroma of apples, fruits, earthy notes.

330 ml bottle from Ammersin 5, Vienna.
Amber, slightly hazy body, with a medium, frothy, bit lacing, white head.
Aroma of funk, lemongrass, barnyard, citrus, sour apples, subtle tropical and stone fruits.
Taste is tart, sour, dry, with sour apples, lemongrass, sour citrus, some barnyard, stone fruits, slight tropical fruits, grass.
Medium mouthfeel, with a lively carbonation.
Finishes dry, sour, hoppy, citric, a bit zesty.

Very nice. Enjoyable combination of a dry sourness and the typical Citra hop notes. Liked the taste more than the nose though, which is even a bit too funky for my taste.

Keg at Brewdog Birmingham. Really delicious. An irresistible blend of tart sherbet pineapple and dry wheaty funk. Paper on the finish. The hops add an extra something, but dont obliterate the beauty.

On tap at Mikkeller The Original. Hazy golden with a lasting white head. Big citra aroma of lime, lemon and mango, with a hint of funk. Dry and tart flavour with citrus, funk and a touch of "jonge lambik popcorn character".

(330ml bottle @ VilleValla Pub, Linköping, May 21 2015) Pours hazed medium gold with small white head and lace. Aroma of sour/tart peach, pear, and unripe mango up front. Citrus along with a bit of grass underneath, making for nice layers. Some light sweaty funk. Very subtle acetic notes. Flavour begins by following the nose, nice and fruity and tart blend of pear, pit fruit, tropical fruit and citrus, but some earthy funky stuff starts to build in the middle. Becomes dry and kind of woody on the aftertaste, almost tannic but not aggressively bitter. Tartness on the finish as well. Pretty full body with fairly high carb. Really like the complexity of hop/fermentation interplay, lots going on, good balance but more than a sour + IPA hops. Top stuff.

Draught at Mikkeller & Friends. Slightly hazy amber color, white head. Sour taste with citrus, peach, tart, hops, earthy notes, acidic notes and a bit of grass. Sour finish with citrus, peach, hops and tart. Excellent sour.
Bottle. Golden with white head. Strong aroma, funky, plastic, citrusy. Similar taste, plastic, lemon, citrus, funk with an earthy yeasty finish. Pretty blooming sour.
Det här var en rätt syrlig sak, dock en fin sak. Smaken var inte helt balanserad men kroppen var fin och upplevelsen total.
Overall: Sour fruits, citric peel. Rubber.Note: On-tap at De Klomp tasting. Reviewed 2015-05-23.
Bottle. Unclear golden body with a medium white head. Citra hops, tart, funk, vinegar, citric, yeast. Funky tart vinegar finish.

Bottle. Hazy amber pour with white head. Aroma is sharp with yeast and underlying citrus. Taste is sour and it keeps on hitting you with various sour notes. Crisp and fresh. High carbonation. Maybe not my preferred type of beer..
33 cl bottle. Hazy yellow to orange with a small white head. Cridp hoppy, citric and bretty aroma. Citric and hoppy. Distinct citrusy. Dry and citric crisp finish.

Draught at Warpigs.
Hazy golden colored with a small white head.
Fruity and light acidic aroma of flowers and citrus.
Light acidic flavor of citrus, hops and flowers.
Tart finish.

Bottle split two ways. Hazy dark golden pour with a small head. Nose is incredibly juicy, grapefruit and some peaches. Taste has lots of grapefruit, some funk, a light tartness, leather and some sweet notes. Super good!

Bottle. Pours yellow with white head. Aroma is hoppy and sour. Citrus hops, grass, grape, pear, peach, ripe tropical fruits, sour apples. Really juicy. Taste is more sweet, peach, juicy, grape, lemon, tangy, sour tart apples. Full smooth body. Really juicy. Dry finish. High carbonation.

Bottle thanks to LukasMH. Pours a clear golden with an average sized, white head. Aroma has lots of citra hops, citrus, mandarin, tangerine, orange, peach, pear, grape fruit, slight peach yoghurt tartness, apricot. Very fruity! Taste is sour and dry, but with a huge, juicy, fruity side. Slight fruity sweetness. Dry finish. Avg-high carbonation, juicy body.

Bottle

Hazy gold Pour.

Hoppy fresh citra nose. Peachy and citrus. Sweet malty notes and mouthwatering sourness. 

Sharp citrus and nice sourness with medium carbonation.. Quite juicy as well..

Bottle. Orange body with white head. Aroma is sour fruity with citrus. Taste is sour apples with some malty sweetness in the background and some hints of herbal hops. Aftertaste is nice sour and dry balanced by some malty sweetness. Very nice one.
Fat bishops örebro. Lätt grumlig orange kulör. Syrlig och frisk doft med stall och citron. Torr och fin smak av äpplekart, hö och jäst

Draft @ Taproom, Malmö. Pours a slightly hazy golden color with a small white head. Has a fruity citrus hoppy sour aroma. Fruity sour tart citrus flavor. Has a fruity sour weak funky citrus hoppy finish.

Pours a slightly murky orange yellow with a minimal white head. Aroma is lemon and funk. Taste is citric bitter orange, lemon, slightly acidic and orange zest. Medium bodied with moderate carbonation.
On tap at Mikkeller Bar Stockholm. Hoppy and tart smell with citrus. Similar taste. Nice and refreshing.

Dark orange. 1 finger head. Smells amazing. Like fresh squeezed tangerines and grapefruit. Taste is petty great. It tastes very young for a Spontan-ale. Very sticky and sugary. Had an overall good taste but its in a weird place currently.

Bottle at home. Clear golden/amber - white head. Earthy, wooden, gooseberies, high citrus, light herbal, nice mellow sourness, light floral aroma, earthy, light fat wooden, grape fruits, peppery, vanilla, sweet wood. Lovely.

Bottle from Cotteridge Wines; hazy golden amber pour with a thin white head, aroma has peach and good dollop of funk, taste has orange, some grain, vinous grape action, tart fruits, hay, sour background, hope MK extend this series.
Pours hazy amber with low white head. Aroma of citrus, green grapes, elderflower, grass. Taste is light sour and fruit tart with mellow sweet finish. Body is light and crisp with soft carbonation.
Bottle at home. Hazy Orange with a small pale head. Aroma and taste is, Tart, Funky, hops, some vinegar, bitter hops. Very good.

pour pale with a fine white head, funky aroma, with pine hints. heavy sour, light bodied, average carbonation, and a long sour aftertaste. 

i think the yeast, aroma takes over, and i would like more Citra aroma!!
